The light travels inside the prism until it hits the next face. Since the prism is a right triangular prism, the light will hit face AB.

At point E, the light ray will refract. Using Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2). Here, n1 = 1 (air), n2 = sqrt(2) (prism), and theta1 = 0 degrees (since it travels perpendicular initially).
The critical angle theta_c for total internal reflection is given by sin(theta_c) = 1/n. sin(theta_c) = 1/sqrt(2) approximately 0.707. theta_c = sin^(-1)(0.707) approximately 45 degrees.

The light ray inside the prism will hit face AB at an angle greater than the critical angle 45 degrees, causing total internal reflection. It will reflect off the face AB and continue towards face BC.
At face BC, the light ray will exit the prism. The angle of incidence at BC is determined by the geometry of the prism and the path of the light inside.

The light exits the prism at an angle that can be calculated using the geometry and refraction principles.
